title: Department of Metal Heat Treatment for Mechanical Engineering

firstPersonCard.name: Parusov Eduard Volodymyrovych
firstPersonCard.description: Doctor of Technical Sciences, Senior Researcher
firstPersonCard.researchDirection: Deformation-thermal treatment of metals and alloys. Features of phase and structural transformations in carbon and alloyed steels during continuous and isothermal cooling. Development and industrial implementation of end-to-end technologies for manufacturing and processing coil-rolled products from low-carbon, high-carbon and low-carbon alloyed steels.

items: Development of scientific and technological foundations for manufacturing next-generation rolled products from carbon, alloyed and low-carbon complex-alloyed steels intended for cold bulk stamping, steel cord, bead wire, high-pressure hoses, reinforcing materials, load-bearing and reinforcement cables, heat-strengthened reinforcement, cold-formed and wire reinforcement, high-strength spring wire, construction fiber, welding wire for gas and oil pipelines, automobile and shipbuilding, replaceable tools for mechanical engineering and metallurgical equipment, etc.
Development of scientific and technological foundations for forming dispersed steel structures with increased wear resistance for hot deformation tools.
Development of scientific and technological foundations for deformation-thermal treatment of large-sized rolling rolls with increased operational stability.
Development of cryogenic treatment technology for complex-alloyed steels with extended service life.
Development of energy-saving modes of softening heat treatment for alloyed and complex-alloyed steel rolled products.
Research of hereditary connections in structure formation processes during crystallization, hot plastic deformation and heat treatment of steels and alloys.
Research of the influence of dendritic structure of cast steel on the formation of structure and properties of rolled products from carbon and alloyed steels.
Research of the influence of chemical composition on segregation manifestation and structure formation in carbon and alloyed steels under hot plastic deformation and heat treatment.
Research of non-metallic inclusion transformation mechanisms at various technological stages of manufacturing and processing rolled products from carbon steels.
Research of peculiarities of non-metallic inclusions' influence on fatigue-corrosion destruction of steels under cyclic loads, including in aggressive environments.
Research of peculiarities of sub- and microstructure transformation in carbon steels during cold plastic deformation.
Modeling of phase-structural transformations and properties in steels and alloys, including using non-equilibrium thermodynamics methods.
Development of additional non-destructive quality control methods for metal products from carbon, alloyed and complex-alloyed steels.
